body_html:
Hi @acbellini ,
I tried with your original reproducer, and yes, with NUM_RUNS set to 10, I get the same results:
TF with const 1.5651498469960643
TF with random 0.3725004669977352

I then changed to NUM_RUNS to 1, and 100 respectively, running time of Mul_Const is constant, while running time of Mul_Random increases linearly as NUM_RUNS increases:
NUM_RUNS=1:
TF with const 1.6104715690016747
TF with random 0.04290775100525934
NUM_RUNS=100:
TF with const 1.625495141997817
TF with random 3.7049192739941645
NUM_RUNS=1000:
TF with const 1.6929292179993354
TF with random 37.42843811100465

I think this shows that Mul_Const performance is invariant to number of session runs.

body:
Hi @acbellini ,
I tried with your original reproducer, and yes, with NUM_RUNS set to 10, I get the same results:
TF with const	 1.5651498469960643
TF with random	 0.3725004669977352

I then changed to NUM_RUNS to 1, and 100 respectively, running time of Mul_Const is constant, while running time of Mul_Random increases linearly as NUM_RUNS increases:
NUM_RUNS=1:
TF with const	 1.6104715690016747
TF with random	 0.04290775100525934
NUM_RUNS=100:
TF with const	 1.625495141997817
TF with random	 3.7049192739941645
NUM_RUNS=1000:
TF with const	 1.6929292179993354
TF with random	 37.42843811100465

I think this shows that Mul_Const performance is invariant to number of session runs.
